intro: Fissistigma latifolium, commonly known as the broadleaf fissistigma, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to parts of Southeast Asia, including countries like Thailand and Vietnam. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of showy, pinkish-white flowers. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
